description: This walk visits the expansive Abriachan Forest in the Highland area of Scotland. The community forest includes a school which encourages learning in the outdoors and health and well being through exercise. The forest has a series of good walking and mountain bike trails to explore. There's around 40km of trails for walkers while cyclists can enjoy a fairly easy 3km green loop and a longer 5km blue trail. You can start the walk from the car parking area to the west of Loch Laide. From here you can pick up a series of trails heading south west towards Rivoulich. Part of the route uses the epic Great Glen Way which passes through the area.
